At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

DS Advisor will have the opportunity to design and develop ML models as part of R&D efforts to identify novel and operationally efficient alternatives to onerous features across clinical, health equity, provider, marketing, and other business areas.

application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

Job Title: Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist - Global Commercial Analytics
Job Description:
Description:
The Global Commercial Analytics (GCA) team – a part of Global Strategy & Operations, GCS – is the analytical engine that enables the Global Commercial business.
GCA is responsible for targeting, acquiring, engaging and retaining commercial customers over online and offline channels and delivering world-class analytics, insights and data products for the Global Commercial Services (GCS). In this role, the incumbent will be part of Direct Mail Analytics team of GCA.
She/He will own the end-to-end analytics required for executing Commercial Direct Mail campaigns and would be responsible to profitably drive growth in commercial acquisition and charge volume through the Direct Mail channel. The person would also be indirectly leading a cross-functional team across different verticals to achieve business outcomes.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Responsibilities:
Work with stakeholders to determine how to use business data for valuable business solutions.
Search for ways to get new data sources and assess their accuracy.
Browse and analyze enterprise databases to simplify and improve product development, marketing techniques, and business processes.
Create custom data models and algorithms.
Use predictive models to improve customer experience, ad targeting, revenue generation, and more.
Develop the organization’s test model quality and A/B testing framework.

Internal Title: Data Science Advisor (LB4)
External Title: Data Scientist

Role Summary
As a member of the Data Science (DS) Center of Expertise (CoE), the DS Advisor is responsible for improving upon integral components of the ML life cycle: feature engineering, model monitoring/triggering, and application development. Reporting to the Head of MLOps & Geospatial DS, the DS Advisor will collaborate with Data Scientists, Business Analysts, and business stakeholders to improve development processes of ML models. DS Advisor will have the opportunity to design and develop ML models as part of R&D efforts to identify novel and operationally efficient alternatives to onerous features across clinical, health equity, provider, marketing, and other business areas.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Mentor and subject matter expert (SME) in data wrangling (e.g., balancing computationally efficient code and readability) in python and SQL

Identify and solutionize opportunities to evolve towards MLOps (e.g., repeatable and scalable workflows for feature engineering, automate model monitoring)

Lead R&D modelling efforts to identify resource efficient alternatives to costly features (e.g., drive-time)

Recommend features to Data Scientists for ML development based on business problem, stakeholder SME recommendations, and performance & utilization trends across Data Science CoE teams

Alongside leadership, prioritize and manage intake towards self-service or ad-hoc support based on strategic engagement, business value, expected model lift, and timeline

SME on a wide array of data sources e.g., claims, geospatial, consumer, business, and other vendor or open data sources


Bachelors or Masters degree in a quantitative field is preferred (e.g., statistics, public health, math, biology, computer science)

Experience with python and SQL via coursework, personal projects, or work projects is a must

Experience with other general programming languages is preferred (e.g., C, perl)

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Experience building statistical models, executing descriptive analytics, and preparing data viz

Comfort communicating to highly technical team members

Experience working with a variety data sources (e.g., survey, claims, EHR, geospatial, open, vendor, etc.)

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Job Description

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

We are a small team and work collaboratively, though remotely. The work we produce is intended for both technical and broader public audiences. Examples include the following:

The Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist will be supervised by the Project Director. The salary will be $70,000 - $80,000 per annum with limited benefits including health insurance.

About Roq.ad
Roq.ad is a fast growing, VC backed, global enterprise SaaS technology company with offices in Berlin, Poznan, Vilnius, London, and San Mateo. Roq.ad provides cross-device technology to improve digital advertising and user analytics. Our cross-device technology is built in-house and complies with EU, US and German privacy regulations. The core of our technology is our Roq.ad Cross-Device Identity Graph, which predicts device connections belonging to the same user based on a probabilistic approach. Many international brands such as McDonalds, WPP and Nielsen are satisfied customers and many market leading AdTech/MarTech companies are our partners.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

About Roq.ad
Roq.ad is a fast growing, VC backed, global enterprise SaaS technology company with offices in Berlin, Poznan, Vilnius, London, and San Mateo. Roq.ad provides cross-device technology to improve digital advertising and user analytics. Our cross-device technology is built in-house and complies with EU, US and German privacy regulations. The core of our technology is our Roq.ad Cross-Device Identity Graph, which predicts device connections belonging to the same user based on a probabilistic approach. Many international brands such as McDonalds, WPP and Nielsen are satisfied customers and many market leading AdTech/MarTech companies are our partners.
We are looking for an experienced Junior Data Scientist to join our team.With a high degree of responsibility, you’ll play an active role in helping shape this large digital advertising market in Europe and the wider future of Roq.ad. The candidate will play an active role in our future and work with us either remotely or from one of our hubs in the US.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

About Roq.ad
Roq.ad is a fast growing, VC backed, global enterprise SaaS technology company with offices in Berlin, Poznan, Vilnius, London, and San Mateo. Roq.ad provides cross-device technology to improve digital advertising and user analytics. Our cross-device technology is built in-house and complies with EU, US and German privacy regulations. The core of our technology is our Roq.ad Cross-Device Identity Graph, which predicts device connections belonging to the same user based on a probabilistic approach. Many international brands such as McDonalds, WPP and Nielsen are satisfied customers and many market leading AdTech/MarTech companies are our partners.
We are looking for an experienced Junior Data Scientist to join our team.With a high degree of responsibility, you’ll play an active role in helping shape this large digital advertising market in Europe and the wider future of Roq.ad. The candidate will play an active role in our future and work with us either remotely or from one of our hubs in the US.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Internal Title: Data Science Advisor (LB4)
External Title: Data Scientist

Role Summary
As a member of the Data Science (DS) Center of Expertise (CoE), the DS Advisor is responsible for improving upon integral components of the ML life cycle: feature engineering, model monitoring/triggering, and application development. Reporting to the Head of MLOps & Geospatial DS, the DS Advisor will collaborate with Data Scientists, Business Analysts, and business stakeholders to improve development processes of ML models. DS Advisor will have the opportunity to design and develop ML models as part of R&D efforts to identify novel and operationally efficient alternatives to onerous features across clinical, health equity, provider, marketing, and other business areas.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Mentor and subject matter expert (SME) in data wrangling (e.g., balancing computationally efficient code and readability) in python and SQL

Identify and solutionize opportunities to evolve towards MLOps (e.g., repeatable and scalable workflows for feature engineering, automate model monitoring)

Lead R&D modelling efforts to identify resource efficient alternatives to costly features (e.g., drive-time)

Recommend features to Data Scientists for ML development based on business problem, stakeholder SME recommendations, and performance & utilization trends across Data Science CoE teams

Alongside leadership, prioritize and manage intake towards self-service or ad-hoc support based on strategic engagement, business value, expected model lift, and timeline

SME on a wide array of data sources e.g., claims, geospatial, consumer, business, and other vendor or open data sources


Bachelors or Masters degree in a quantitative field is preferred (e.g., statistics, public health, math, biology, computer science)

Experience with python and SQL via coursework, personal projects, or work projects is a must

Experience with other general programming languages is preferred (e.g., C, perl)

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Experience building statistical models, executing descriptive analytics, and preparing data viz

Comfort communicating to highly technical team members

Experience working with a variety data sources (e.g., survey, claims, EHR, geospatial, open, vendor, etc.)

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

*will work ONSITE 2-3 days each week

application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.

application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

*will work ONSITE 2-3 days each week

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

As a member of the Data Science (DS) Center of Expertise (CoE), the DS Advisor is responsible for improving upon integral components of the ML life cycle: feature engineering, model monitoring/triggering, and application development. This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Experience building statistical models, executing descriptive analytics, and preparing data viz

Comfort communicating to highly technical team members

Experience working with a variety data sources (e.g., survey, claims, EHR, geospatial, open, vendor, etc.)

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

Who We’re Looking For

Roq.ad is a fast growing, VC backed, global enterprise SaaS technology company with offices in Berlin, Poznan, Vilnius, London, and San Mateo. Roq.ad provides cross-device technology to improve digital advertising and user analytics. Our cross-device technology is built in-house and complies with EU, US and German privacy regulations. The core of our technology is our Roq.ad Cross-Device Identity Graph, which predicts device connections belonging to the same user based on a probabilistic approach. Many international brands such as McDonalds, WPP and Nielsen are satisfied customers and many market leading AdTech/MarTech companies are our partners.

Direct hire data scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science and other computational disciplines while tackling NSA's highest priority mission challenges. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts internally and from industry and academia as well as discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at technical roundtables. The Data Science Development Program (DSDP) is a three-year opportunity to develop and enhance your data science skills for an NSA career. Participants experience the breadth of data science at NSA through six- to nine-month assignments in a variety of diverse organizations, and collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts from industry and academia. You will routinely discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at weekly technical roundtables. You will study data science and related subjects in NSA-taught classes. We foster an environment where you will develop your data science skills, allowing you to quickly contribute to NSA's highest priority mission challenges. Graduates of the DSDP may choose their first permanent assignments from any of the NSA Directorates, depending on availability As a Data Scientist at NSA, your responsibilities may include: - Exploratory data analysis and exploratory model-fitting to reveal data features of interest - Machine-learned predictive modeling - Construct usable data sets from multiple sources to meet customer needs - Identifying and analyzing anomalous data (including metadata) - Developing conceptual design and models to address mission requirements - Developing qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing datasets in various states. - Performing analytic modeling, scripting, and/or programming - Working collaboratively and iteratively throughout the data-science lifecycle - Designing and developing analytics and techniques for analysis - Analyzing data using mathematical and statistical methods - Evaluating, documenting, and communicating research processes, analyses, and results to customers, peers, and leadership - Creating interpretable visualizations

Internal Title: Data Science Advisor (LB4)
External Title: Data Scientist

Role Summary
As a member of the Data Science (DS) Center of Expertise (CoE), the DS Advisor is responsible for improving upon integral components of the ML life cycle: feature engineering, model monitoring/triggering, and application development. Reporting to the Head of MLOps & Geospatial DS, the DS Advisor will collaborate with Data Scientists, Business Analysts, and business stakeholders to improve development processes of ML models. DS Advisor will have the opportunity to design and develop ML models as part of R&D efforts to identify novel and operationally efficient alternatives to onerous features across clinical, health equity, provider, marketing, and other business areas.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Mentor and subject matter expert (SME) in data wrangling (e.g., balancing computationally efficient code and readability) in python and SQL

Lead R&D modelling efforts to identify resource efficient alternatives to costly features (e.g., drive-time)

Recommend features to Data Scientists for ML development based on business problem, stakeholder SME recommendations, and performance & utilization trends across Data Science CoE teams

Alongside leadership, prioritize and manage intake towards self-service or ad-hoc support based on strategic engagement, business value, expected model lift, and timeline

SME on a wide array of data sources e.g., claims, geospatial, consumer, business, and other vendor or open data sources


Bachelors or Masters degree in a quantitative field is preferred (e.g., statistics, public health, math, biology, computer science)

Experience with python and SQL via coursework, personal projects, or work projects is a must

Experience with other general programming languages is preferred (e.g., C, perl)

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Experience building statistical models, executing descriptive analytics, and preparing data viz

Comfort communicating to highly technical team members

Experience working with a variety data sources (e.g., survey, claims, EHR, geospatial, open, vendor, etc.)

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

Who We’re Looking For

Direct hire data scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science and other computational disciplines while tackling NSA's highest priority mission challenges. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts internally and from industry and academia as well as discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at technical roundtables. The Data Science Development Program (DSDP) is a three-year opportunity to develop and enhance your data science skills for an NSA career. Participants experience the breadth of data science at NSA through six- to nine-month assignments in a variety of diverse organizations, and collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts from industry and academia. You will routinely discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at weekly technical roundtables. You will study data science and related subjects in NSA-taught classes. We foster an environment where you will develop your data science skills, allowing you to quickly contribute to NSA's highest priority mission challenges. Graduates of the DSDP may choose their first permanent assignments from any of the NSA Directorates, depending on availability As a Data Scientist at NSA, your responsibilities may include: - Exploratory data analysis and exploratory model-fitting to reveal data features of interest - Machine-learned predictive modeling - Construct usable data sets from multiple sources to meet customer needs - Identifying and analyzing anomalous data (including metadata) - Developing conceptual design and models to address mission requirements - Developing qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing datasets in various states. - Performing analytic modeling, scripting, and/or programming - Working collaboratively and iteratively throughout the data-science lifecycle - Designing and developing analytics and techniques for analysis - Analyzing data using mathematical and statistical methods - Evaluating, documenting, and communicating research processes, analyses, and results to customers, peers, and leadership - Creating interpretable visualizations

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.

application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Direct hire data scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science and other computational disciplines while tackling NSA's highest priority mission challenges. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts internally and from industry and academia as well as discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at technical roundtables. The Data Science Development Program (DSDP) is a three-year opportunity to develop and enhance your data science skills for an NSA career. Participants experience the breadth of data science at NSA through six- to nine-month assignments in a variety of diverse organizations, and collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts from industry and academia. You will routinely discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at weekly technical roundtables. You will study data science and related subjects in NSA-taught classes. We foster an environment where you will develop your data science skills, allowing you to quickly contribute to NSA's highest priority mission challenges. Graduates of the DSDP may choose their first permanent assignments from any of the NSA Directorates, depending on availability As a Data Scientist at NSA, your responsibilities may include: - Exploratory data analysis and exploratory model-fitting to reveal data features of interest - Machine-learned predictive modeling - Construct usable data sets from multiple sources to meet customer needs - Identifying and analyzing anomalous data (including metadata) - Developing conceptual design and models to address mission requirements - Developing qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing datasets in various states. - Performing analytic modeling, scripting, and/or programming - Working collaboratively and iteratively throughout the data-science lifecycle - Designing and developing analytics and techniques for analysis - Analyzing data using mathematical and statistical methods - Evaluating, documenting, and communicating research processes, analyses, and results to customers, peers, and leadership - Creating interpretable visualizations

Are you curious about applying analytics to business problems and interested in a career in data science? Plus, over time we’ll train you on our advanced analytics and machine learning models so you can grow into a full data science role.
Day in the Life
Perform rigorous data validation and conduct deep dive analysis to understand each customer’s unique business needs to drive product configuration decisions (using SQL or Python). Examples include:
o Analysis to understand seasonal patterns in a customer’s demand
o Analysis to understand a customer’s current pricing volatility
o Analysis to identify markets or segments with largest opportunities for revenue growth

Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

Direct hire data scientists are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science and other computational disciplines while tackling NSA's highest priority mission challenges. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts internally and from industry and academia as well as discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at technical roundtables. The Data Science Development Program (DSDP) is a three-year opportunity to develop and enhance your data science skills for an NSA career. Participants experience the breadth of data science at NSA through six- to nine-month assignments in a variety of diverse organizations, and collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts from industry and academia. You will routinely discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at weekly technical roundtables. You will study data science and related subjects in NSA-taught classes. We foster an environment where you will develop your data science skills, allowing you to quickly contribute to NSA's highest priority mission challenges. Graduates of the DSDP may choose their first permanent assignments from any of the NSA Directorates, depending on availability As a Data Scientist at NSA, your responsibilities may include: - Exploratory data analysis and exploratory model-fitting to reveal data features of interest - Machine-learned predictive modeling - Construct usable data sets from multiple sources to meet customer needs - Identifying and analyzing anomalous data (including metadata) - Developing conceptual design and models to address mission requirements - Developing qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing datasets in various states. - Performing analytic modeling, scripting, and/or programming - Working collaboratively and iteratively throughout the data-science lifecycle - Designing and developing analytics and techniques for analysis - Analyzing data using mathematical and statistical methods - Evaluating, documenting, and communicating research processes, analyses, and results to customers, peers, and leadership - Creating interpretable visualizations

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Role Summary
As a member of the Data Science (DS) Center of Expertise (CoE), the DS Advisor is responsible for improving upon integral components of the ML life cycle: feature engineering, model monitoring/triggering, and application development. Reporting to the Head of MLOps & Geospatial DS, the DS Advisor will collaborate with Data Scientists, Business Analysts, and business stakeholders to improve development processes of ML models. DS Advisor will have the opportunity to design and develop ML models as part of R&D efforts to identify novel and operationally efficient alternatives to onerous features across clinical, health equity, provider, marketing, and other business areas.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


application development, feature engineering, and model monitoring/triggering

Mentor and subject matter expert (SME) in data wrangling (e.g., balancing computationally efficient code and readability) in python and SQL

Identify and solutionize opportunities to evolve towards MLOps (e.g., repeatable and scalable workflows for feature engineering, automate model monitoring)

Lead R&D modelling efforts to identify resource efficient alternatives to costly features (e.g., drive-time)

Recommend features to Data Scientists for ML development based on business problem, stakeholder SME recommendations, and performance & utilization trends across Data Science CoE teams

Alongside leadership, prioritize and manage intake towards self-service or ad-hoc support based on strategic engagement, business value, expected model lift, and timeline

SME on a wide array of data sources e.g., claims, geospatial, consumer, business, and other vendor or open data sources


Bachelors or Masters degree in a quantitative field is preferred (e.g., statistics, public health, math, biology, computer science)

Experience with python and SQL via coursework, personal projects, or work projects is a must

Experience with other general programming languages is preferred (e.g., C, perl)

Values diversity, growth mindset, and improving health outcomes of our customers

Experience building statistical models, executing descriptive analytics, and preparing data viz

Comfort communicating to highly technical team members

Experience working with a variety data sources (e.g., survey, claims, EHR, geospatial, open, vendor, etc.)

In the face of the danger posed by COVID to people incarcerated in prisons and jails, the UCLA Prison Law and Policy Program launched the UCLA COVID Behind Bars Data Project in March 2020. Currently a team of seven staff and dozens of volunteers, the Project tracks the spread and impact of COVID in prisons and jails and advocates for greater transparency and accountability around the pandemic response of the carceral system.

The Project seeks a Senior Data Scientist or Data Scientist to join our interdisciplinary team of data scientists and policy researchers to obtain, process, and analyze COVID data from carceral facilities, including state and federal prisons, county and city jails, immigration detention centers, and juvenile detention centers.

We are a small team and work collaboratively, though remotely. The work we produce is intended for both technical and broader public audiences. Examples include the following:

3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.

As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

Job Title: Computer Vision ML Engineer Data Scientist
Job Description:
3 years ago, we founded a biotech company in the USA. We are creating an AI technology for online early diagnosis of fatal diseases, which can extend an active life by 20 years, slow & reverse aging. The technology is based on Big Data collected over 70 years by the G-20 countries.
At various times, the company was advised by leading scientists, incl. Alexey Moskalev (Russia) and the Principal of the Harvard Medical School Vadim Gladyshev (USA).
The first data set was provided by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology from the USA (MIT) - 60,000 depersonalized profiles.
Have 4 mobile app awards & recently was named by Blue Tulip Awards 2021 (supported by world's famous consulting firm Accenture) as one of the top 20 health innovative companies.

Center Information:
The Quantitative Biomedical Research Center (QBRC) is a well-established research center at UT Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW). It aims to foster collaborations involving quantitative methods and technologies in any aspect of biomedical research, particularly for understanding disease etiologies and developing treatment and prevention strategies. Currently, the center has six faculty members, around 40 staff members, postdocs and student research assistants. We are actively recruiting new members to join this new and dynamic group.
Position Title: Data Scientist I, II, III, Computational biologist I, II, III or Postdoctoral Fellow (Bioinformatics/Biostatistics)
Duties & Responsibilities: For bioinformatics scientists, the projects include developing novel method for analysis and integration of multiple-omics data, and single cell genomics and transcriptome analysis. For data scientists, the projects include assembling and statistical analyses of big clinical data, and application of machine learning and deep learning methods on real medical problems.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular state within the US. We welcome applicants from throughout the US.
